WorkItem.Description:
If an event email is sent, and no members have RSVP'd or event is not flagged for 'online sign-ups'. The following error occurs:
 
A recipient must be specified. 
Description: An unhandled exception occurred during the execution of the current web request. Please review the stack trace for more information about the error and where it originated in the code. 
 
Exception Details: System.InvalidOperationException: A recipient must be specified.
 
Source Error: 
 
 
Line 87: 
Line 88:         Dim smtp As New SmtpClient
Line 89:         smtp.Send(msgMail)
Line 90: 
Line 91:         Response.Redirect("~/Events/View.aspx?eventid=" & EventID)
 
 
Source File: d:\Domains\mialga.co.uk\wwwroot\Admin\EventEmail.aspx.vb    Line: 89 
 
Stack Trace: 
 
 
[InvalidOperationException: A recipient must be specified.]
   System.Net.Mail.SmtpClient.Send(MailMessage message) +2209
   Admin_EventEmail.btnSend_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e) in d:\Domains\mialga.co.uk\wwwroot\Admin\EventEmail.aspx.vb:89
   System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.OnClick(EventArgs e) +105
   System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.RaisePostBackEvent(String eventArgument) +107
   System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent(String eventArgument) +7
   System.Web.UI.Page.RaisePostBackEvent(IPostBackEventHandler sourceControl, String eventArgument) +11
   System.Web.UI.Page.RaisePostBackEvent(NameValueCollection postData) +33
   System.Web.UI.Page.ProcessRequestMain(Boolean includeStagesBeforeAsyncPoint, Boolean includeStagesAfterAsyncPoint) +1746
 
This is obviously going to happen as the SMTP routing has not got any recipient to send the email to.

Comments.Message: Does anyone have a fix for this problem?
